Complete Flow Summary
When you click "Run workflow" with version=v1.1.0, environment=test:

✅ Checks out code at tag v1.1.0
✅ Installs Python 3.11
✅ Installs your app dependencies
✅ Runs tests (fails → stops here if tests fail)
✅ Logs into Azure
✅ Installs Terraform
✅ Initializes Terraform
✅ Plans infrastructure for "test" environment with v1.1.0
✅ Creates/updates Azure resources
✅ Gets App Service name: "app-todo-app-test"
✅ Deploys v1.1.0 code to that App Service
✅ Updates deployment-history.md
✅ Commits and pushes history

Think about, on a high level:

# 1. Get the code
git clone repo
git checkout v1.0.0

# 2. Test it locally
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
pytest tests/

# 3. Login to Azure
az login

# 4. Create infrastructure
cd terraform
terraform init
terraform plan
terraform apply

# 5. Deploy code
az webapp up --name app-todo-app-dev
